channel.title: Transcriptomics on CityU-Bioinformatics
channel.description: Recent content in Transcriptomics on CityU-Bioinformatics

item.title: Low-level RNA detection
item.description: Table of Contents Low-level RNA detection Patch-seq RRR | Patch-seq Reduced-Rank Regression scRNA-seq analysis Noise reduction scLVM | single-cell Latent Variable Model OEFinder URSM | Unified RNA-Sequencing Model Transcript quantification TraCeR BRIE | Bayesian Regression for Isoform Estimation UMIS | Unique Molecular IdentifierS Cell lineage and pseudotime inference/ Marker gene detection Seurat SPADE | Spanning tree Progression of Density normalized Events Monocle Single-cell qPCR DPT MAST | Model-based Analysis of Single-cell Transcriptomics SCATTOME | Single Cell Analysis of Targeted TranscriptOME dPCR ddPCRclust Definetherain ddpcr | droplet digital polymerase chain reaction Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Low-level RNA detection Patch-seq RRR | Patch-seq Reduced-Rank Regression Provides an interpretable visualization of the relationship between high-dimensional single cell transcriptomes and electrophysiological information obtained using techniques like patch-seq.

item.title: Non-Coding RNA
item.description: Table of Contents Non-Coding RNA Analysis miRNA Target Prediction TargetScan PicTar psRNATarget miRNA Enrichment DIANA-miRPath FAME | Functional Assignment of MicroRNAs via Enrichment miTEA miRNA-disease Association Prediction miRPD MCMG RNAi Reagent Design RNAxs WMD | Web MicroRNA Designer E-RNAi High-throughput RNAi Screening cellHTS CARD Small RNA sequencing Data analysis (sRNA-seq Analysis) tRNA-derived RNA Annotation tRF2Cancer HAMR ncRNA Identification miRDeep omiRas IsomiR detection DeAnnIso isomiR-SEA miRNA Array analysis InCroMAP AgiMicroRna Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Non-Coding RNA Analysis Noncoding RNAs (ncRNAs) accomplish a remarkable variety of biological functions.

item.title: RNA Modifications
item.description: Table of Contents RNA Modifications Analysis Protein-binding Region Prediction RNAcompete catRAPID omics RBPmap Alternative Splicing Annotation APPRIS rPGA Exogean RNA Methylation Prediction SRAMP iRNAm5C-PseDNC m6Apred Methylated RNA Immunoprecipitation Sequencing Data Analysis (MeRIP-seq Analysis) Spliced Read Alignment TopHat HISAT | Hierarchical Indexing for Spliced Alignment of Transcripts Subread Peak Calling ExomePeak | Peak calling : MeRIP-seq analysis MeTPeak De novo motif discovery Weeder HOMER | Hypergeometric Optimization of Motif EnRichment MEME Suite Degradome-seq Analysis sPARTA package CleaveLand Find more tools: OMICTOOLS RNA Modifications Analysis From a biosynthetic point of view, the roughly 100 known different RNA nucleotide modifications can be easily divided according to their complexity.

item.title: RNA Transcription
item.description: Table of Contents Transcription analysis Prognostic Biomarker Identification Region Discrimination Gene co-expression prediction Gene regulatory network inference Gene set enrichment analysis Over-representation analysisi RNA-seq analysis Read count Known transcript quantification Gene fusion detection Prognostic biomarker identification Differential expression Alternative splicing events identification CAGE Analysis TSS detection De novo motif discovery Gene expression array analysis Differential expression detection Time course Meta-analysis Metatranscriptomic sequencing analysis Prediction-base Taxonomic Homology-Based Taxonomic Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Transcription analysis Transcript abundance is in many ways an extraordinary phenotype, with special attributes that confer particular importance on an understanding of its genetics.

item.title: RNA-Protein Interactions
item.description: Table of Contents CLIP-seq Analysis Peak Calling DFilter CLIPper Motif Discovery RNAmotifs MEMERIS miRNA Target Site Detection MicroMUMMIE MIRZA Ribo-seq Analysis Ribosome P-site Localization RiboProfiling riboWaltz Ribosome Stalling Prediction ROSE Translated ORF Prediction ORF-RATER Find more tools: OMICTOOLS CLIP-seq Analysis Cross-Linking Immunoprecipitation associated to high-throughput sequencing (CLIP-seq) is a technique used to identify RNA directly bound to RNA-binding proteins across the entire transcriptome in cell or tissue samples.
